could you have similar problem to https://github.com/openzipkin/docker-zipkin/issues/181?

ps not merging intentionally until we get some experience with the
experiment. reason is that this is api breaking
FYI we have zero tests in this area of the codebase. I will sort (pun intended) that later. For now, tested manually.

looks like this. we trace undertow internally in zipkin as zipkin uses
undertow
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/src/main/java/zipkin/server/internal/brave/TracingHttpHandlerConfiguration.java

A couple other reasons spans could be missing:
1. Span was dropped (pick a reason, but not all spans come in the same message, one message could get dropped)
2. Server died before reporting the span
3. More than 10k spans in the trace so some simply weren't loaded

Not saying this isn't a good idea.  Just make sure you put the appropriate message in the warning ;)

My favorite would involve a change to Zipkin more than the server it's running on.  But it's: #1960.  Basically, if you don't buffer data then you don't need a big heap ;)

I think we've also found that small, potentially rapid requests help (easier to flush small bits from the buffer than large blobs).  But we didn't have fantastic metrics when we made that change :\
good idea. we can detect malformed traces for many cases

thank you. you might notice we made large cleanup of (v1) code with only
porting of integration tests left todo. features like this are ok now to
start if you want. particularly the collector is now separate jar so we can
consider things even past java 8.

What we experimented doing is showing a small warning sign left to spans without a parent rather than showing a big banner. That's less intrusive and much more intuitive. It also helps you understand if you're just missing a very small portion of the trace or a lot of spans.

If you're wondering why there's a blank hole in the trace and notice that the next span is missing its parent that'd explain it. It also helps when spans are rendered in weird places in the UI (usually at the bottom) since the reason there is that without a parent id it's impossible to attach them in the right place. This seems a better approach than a single banner since that one wouldn't give you enough context to understand how broken the trace is and what's actually missing.

>  Just make sure you put the appropriate message in the warning

In this case the error is simply something like "The parent for this span is missing", which would work whatever the reason for dropping that span.
I have see the doc EnableZipkinServer which is Deprecated . Are there any example about  tracing between play project and  undertow project

no one has asked for this type of integration example. you can look at
play-zipkin-tracing in github. not sure if it needs any changes for
undertown.

Hi,

I am new to the zipkin. I have started using zipkin from docker image from docker hub i.e. openzipkin/zipkin:latest .
I found that the /spans POST API is not supported by default. Do we need to enable it explicitly?
Is this supported zipkin v2?

Thanks,
Prasad

@wuyoushan Please use the latest released version of the server. You can find the quick start instructions here: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/#quick-start

If you have further questions, please ask us on Gitter (https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin) because we prefer to use GitHub issues for feature requests, bug reports, and enhancement requests.
@pvprsd please join us on Gitter (https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin) if you have questions.

I don't believe that this feature would be trivial, but I would certainly find it beneficial.  I use Zipkin with a system where traces are long running, and it would be _very_ nice if Zipkin could be used to investigate problems as they are happening, instead of only after the fact.

I think this is unrelated. This repository is about zipkin server. The
stacktrace you paste is not from Zipkin server as zipkin doesn't use sleuth
internally.

"java.io.IOException: Broken pipe" can be found on trouble shooting sites,
but yes such an exception should end up in zipkin data. First verify your
tracing setup is working normally. After that, join a troubleshooting
channel such as https://gitter.im/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-sleuth for more

I will close this issue as it won't be solved in this repository
duplicate of #2136

I was looking for this as well, our api-gateway team requires a definition to be configured so that zipkin browser clients can start reporting span data 'safely' through the gateway. 

I guess i could just tell them to fetch it from zipkin.io , but somehow it feels safer if it comes from an actual running server instance on the inside .. but that's probably unjustified angst knowing how stable the api is / has been / will be.

pull request welcome or tell us if help is needed.

the server is stable with v2 api at this point although i think the swagger
api doesnt discuss POST with proto3

you can try using our normal kafka reporter, or putting your code in our test to make the effects easier to see 

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-reporter-java/blob/master/kafka11/src/test/java/zipkin2/reporter/kafka11/KafkaSenderTest.java#L61

Meanwhile this issues list is for changes to the server, not troubleshooting. Please use gitter for more help https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin

annotation containing word error

no problem!

do you have variables in your span names? Span names should be fixed
cardinality. If you have something like an http route, make sure this is
used instead of paths with variables in it.

https://github.com/openzipkin/brave/tree/master/instrumentation/http#http-route-cardinality
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-api/blob/master/zipkin.proto#L108
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-api/blob/master/zipkin2-api.yaml#L312
Thanks for the quick response.   We are using Spring Cloud -Dalston RELEASE with sleuth.  By default, it puts variables in the span name.
I just tested the lastest Spring Cloud and found the cardinality has been fixed in this Finchley RELEASE,  like span name: " get /user/{userId}"
Lol there's a PR to allow this in chosen which is open since 2011 and never got merged: https://github.com/harvesthq/chosen/pull/166
The main suggestion seems to be to use select2 :/

This needs to be tread very carefully, as it doesn't just impact us but
also anything downstream or anything aggregation in nature that works off
assumptions that span is low or relatively fixed cardinality. Internally,
this affects how search works, and relaxing this also limits our ability to
improve aggregations.

example issue which is knock-on effect: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2139
also the work we are trying to do to relate metrics name to span name would be thwarted as metrics dimensions are similarly fixed cardinality

Yeah, the best approach is probably for us to implement https://github.com/Yelp/pyramid_zipkin/issues/93.

That might solve it for most services (as long as they don't have > 1k endpoints)

thanks for opening the issue though. context around this topic changes
every so often
Same issue for normal annotation values, can you please fix it in logs as well

zipkin doesn't have logs. I presume you mean to say annotations where
someone encoded json as the value.. first check to see if that is valid.
for example one thing that causes this is OpenTracing, but as far as I
recall, "logs" are encoded in annotation as k1=v1,k2=v2 which is
simultaneously easier to read (in one line) and also not json.

Yes its annotations. We are actually storing the full json request and response message in annotation so that it become easier to co-relate.

We could use tags, but tag has it own overhead of indexing at database layer (like cassandra, elastic search)

I have added same fix in annotations, can you please verify and merge

regardless of whether this is merged, please let us know what instrumentation caused this as annotations are not intended to be used as logs or include newlines. When we add workarounds, it is a reasonable request to ask why, so in case whatever we are working around is fixed, the workaround can be considered for removal

I understand, annotation is meant for one line only, but appending full request/response in log helps in tracing the message. Changes are minor and has no impact on any other functionality. This is to fix the UI Display when there is json message in log, attaching UI screenshots before fix after fix
Please verify latest changes and merge
version is zipkin-release-2.10.2

As part of the [2.10 release](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/releases/tag/2.10.1), we dropped the v1 read HTTP endpoints. If you use the v2 endpoint (as the UI itself does now), it should work. I'm curious: what is the use case for accessing the HTTP endpoint directly?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38642570/42997443-4b96d9ca-8c49-11e8-9ef9-7502d768525f.png)

The download address of zipkin-server.jar is https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/zipkin/java/zipkin-server/2.10.2/zipkin-server-2.10.2-exec.jar
@595979101 Thank you for the additional information. This looks like a bug, then. We should update the UI to use the v2 endpoint.
dare you to cut a release ;)

in this case the camel instrumentation needs to be updated. The problem is that it is treating everything like a client-server request, but also I'm not sure the lags agree with what you expect.

The same thing that red hat folks have done to update the opentracing tracer could be done to the zipkin one, and likely things would be fine. opentracing api is very similar to brave 4.

https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/master/components/camel-opentracing/src/main/java/org/apache/camel/opentracing/decorators/AbstractMessagingSpanDecorator.java

I've helped with renovating as red hat folks for whatever reason don't lately. It would be nice if someone could take a stab at porting what's been done in camel-opentracing to camel-zipkin with brave 4. The current code in camel-zipkin is basically dead end and if anyone (regardless of employer) were to take the basics of what red hat did in camel-opentracing back to the original tracer, I suspect a lot of folks would be better off for it. Could you be that person?
I opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-12672 to solve the root problem, which is that the instrumentation approach is dead-end

Thank you so much for your investigation and time you've spent, but unfortunately I messed everything up with service naming and led you to wrong assumptions. 
`camel-producer` and `camel-consumer` are not using `camel-zipkin` lib, that lib is not covering my needs, so I decided to make lib myself (https://github.com/Playtika/sleuth-camel) hopeful after I get proper result we will publish it to maven central. Next step - to contribute to spring-cloud-sleuth project for 2.0 boot and brave support, my lib is targeting 1.5 boot which is my preference so far.

Anyway issue I posted is related to JSON's which I attached below, they seems to be correct and I see that Zipkin got them and parse them in proper way, but unfortunately not showing the desired result of lag, which I trying yo achieve. I'm not pointing that this is a bug, maybe it's by design, just wanted to have confirmation of that.
@595979101 the fix for this is released now as version 2.10.3.
Ok, thank you. You fixed this bug too fast

Thanks!

hi and thanks! definitely we can consider things though I do not expect us to change the order as it is not only a matter in ES but other storage like Cassandra. we can't change that because when scrolling through a lot of data server side.. it will be unreasonable. you can look at some older issues about sort order. changing the query api is a big process as we have to support all storage type not just elastic search.

on the skipping aggregation if you can get integration tests to pass then give a try. we also don't want to do more work then necessary. thank you very much for your research.
so i will submit a light PR without sorting,since  sorting indeed  needs a lot of modifications
i have tested codes locally, if you have any questions,please @ JarVzhao ~

right, so I'm sorry the tests will "ignore" if elasticsearch isn't running and docker is not installed. You can see the failure here https://travis-ci.org/openzipkin/zipkin/builds/407517059

First thing is to run the tests then you will know what works or not with this approach. Thanks again for giving a try.
sorry,i forgot to run the unit tests. i use a local es,spans are from sleuth, the ui query is ok.

full request and response is better for a tag than annotation. can you try that instead?

each strange thing we support makes changing UI later more difficult. I will close this until there are more people asking to do what you are.

ps even if we have requests to make zipkin a logging system, due to opentracing for example, we cannot afford that responsibility and it is an unfair burden. usually logging ends up with new problems in search, bulk and indexing.

you can see issues in jaeger for example. eventhough they initially encouraged tracing as logging and have a lot of staff, they have many issues including search indexing and volume and are even looking at rearchitecting to collect logs from elsewhere. 
https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/search?p=2&q=logging&type=Issues

many libraries have the ability to correlate with trace and span IDs and you can configure the UI to use a search expression link to get to logs. zipkin basically is used to integrate with logging and metrics not be a one stop shop.

Ex here are the docs on integration which can be improved as well.

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-ui/README.md#how-do-i-find-logs-associated-with-a-particular-trace
Thanks Adrian for the explaination

I agree with your point of zipkin is not a logging system. The fix which in this PR is just a minor UI display fix, where dialog box goes out of screen. It has no functional impact. Look at the UI screenshot attached above.

I think we should add this fix to mainline, request you to re-think about it.

You don't have a history of helping in the UI, so it isn't yet a good time
for you to assess the maintenance impact of this. That said, I will
reconsider once others ask for the same thing.

Meanwhile, if you must do what you are doing, tag instead of annotation.

PS I think easiest way is to add CollectorComponent.blockOnStorage option. This would allow us to wait until there's another request available, and suitable for most storage implementations. Even if elasticsearch returns unavailable, it will at least wait for that to occur.

ZIPKIN_UI_BASEPATH | "/zipkin/zipkin"

spring.sleuth.sampler.percentage= 0.2

My application dont connect with zipkin.

I only want a zipkin in memory storage.

Any solution ?

Thank you for your time. :)
